Modeling Building Elements - Exercise 3

Learn Revit > Module 1 > Exercise 3

Creating Floors and Roofs

In this exercise, you will create flat roofs and pitched roofs for the house used in the previous exercise using Autodesk Revit.

Objectives:

  • Create roofs based on the building footprint.

  • Sketch a roof boundary and selecting the slope-defining edges.

  • Set the roof level and slope instance properties.

Create a flat roof

  1. Download the start file here.

  2. Open the Workspace Roof plan view.

  3. On the Architecture tab, click Roof by Footprint.

  4. In Properties Palette, select Basic Roof Generic - 12” roof type and set Base Offset from Level = 0’-0” (0m).

  5. In Modify | Create Roof Footprint tab, confirm Boundary Line and Line mode is selected.

    a. Unmark Defines slope check box.

  6. Create a closed boundary as indicated by the 4 sketch lines numbered below. The sketch lines should be placed on the inside face of walls.

    a. Click Modify command to end sketching.

    *Note: Linework must be contiguous.*

  7. Click Finish Edit Mode to create the 3D roof element.

    Note: If you receive error messages, confirm that none of the linework overlaps itself. Then try Finish Edit mode again.

  8. Open the Carport Roof plan view.

  9. Create the other flat roof using the same technique in steps 4 through 8.

  10. Hit Modify to end creating roofs.

  11. Select highlighted wall shown below.

    a. Click Attach Top / Base

    b. Click edge of Flat roof just created

Create a pitched roof

  1. Open the Living Area Roof plan view.

  2. On the Architecture tab, click Roof by Footprint.

  3. In Properties Palette, select Basic Roof Generic - 12” roof type and set Base Offset from Level = 0’-0” (0m).

  4. In Modify | Create Roof Footprint tab, confirm Boundary Line and Line mode is selected.

    a. Mark Defines slope check box.

  5. Create a closed boundary as indicated by the (10) sketch lines numbered below. Trace over the red linework in the view.

    a. Click Modify command to end sketching.

    *Note: Linework must be contiguous.*

  6. Set the roof pitch for the sloped linework.

    a. Window select all of the sketch linework for the roof sketch.

    b. In Properties palette, set pitch to 3” (0.0762m).

  7. Click Finish Edit Mode to create the 3D roof element.

    Note: If you receive error messages, confirm that none of the linework overlaps itself. Then try Finish Edit mode again.

    a. Attach highlighted walls to roof? Click Yes.

  8. Finished roof exercise below

  9. Save the Revit file as: Module01Ex03_Finished.rvt and hand in.

    This concludes Exercise 3.
